channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Belgian Olympic team bows out of triathlon as teammate falls ill after swim in the Seine
item.description: All triathletes have been barred from practice swim in Paris river Sunday after poor water quality test results.
item.content:encoded:
All triathletes have been barred from practice swim in Paris river Sunday after poor water quality test results.

(Image credit: Laure Boyer/Hans Lucas)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Rapper Flavor Flav on why he decided to sponsor the U.S. women's water polo team
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks to rapper Flavor Flav about his decision to sponsor the U.S. Women's water polo team at the 2024 Olympic Games.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks to rapper Flavor Flav about his decision to sponsor the U.S. Women's water polo team at the 2024 Olympic Games.

item.title: At the G20, a billionaire tax is being proposed. But is it feasible?
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with economist Gabriel Zucman, who created a blueprint for a global wealth tax that the Brazilian government recently introduced at a G20 meeting.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with economist Gabriel Zucman, who created a blueprint for a global wealth tax that the Brazilian government recently introduced at a G20 meeting.

item.title: In China, AI-generated avatars are making work easier for some online influencers
item.description: Do you sometimes wish you could clone yourself to complete all your work? Companies in China are creating digital avatars using generative artificial intelligence to do just that.
item.content:encoded: Do you sometimes wish you could clone yourself to complete all your work? Companies in China are creating digital avatars using generative artificial intelligence to do just that.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: In Missouri, Rep. Cori Bush faces a primary challenge over views on Israel
item.description: Democratic Rep. Cori Bush’s criticism of Israel’s military actions in Gaza partly prompted her main primary challenger, prosecutor Wesley Bell, to enter the race.
item.content:encoded: Democratic Rep. Cori Bush’s criticism of Israel’s military actions in Gaza partly prompted her main primary challenger, prosecutor Wesley Bell, to enter the race.
item.dc:creator: Jason Rosenbaum

item.title: The Borel wildfire is devastating parts of California. One man shares his story
item.description: There are more than 80 major wildfires burning across the western United States. In California, one family escaped the Borel fire, which continues to engulf large swaths of land.
item.content:encoded: There are more than 80 major wildfires burning across the western United States. In California, one family escaped the Borel fire, which continues to engulf large swaths of land.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Far-right, anti-immigration riots persist across the U.K. Here's what to know
item.description: Over the past week, hundreds of protesters were arrested, dozens of officers were injured and multiple buildings were damaged, including a mosque and a hotel known to have housed asylum seekers, following the killing of three girls at a dance class.
item.content:encoded:
Over the past week, hundreds of protesters were arrested, dozens of officers were injured and multiple buildings were damaged, including a mosque and a hotel known to have housed asylum seekers, following the killing of three girls at a dance class.

(Image credit: Christopher Furlong)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Scottie Scheffler wins Olympic gold after a comeback victory
item.description: Scheffler ties course record at France's Le Golf National to win gold for the United States
item.content:encoded:
Scheffler ties course record at France's Le Golf National to win gold for the United States

(Image credit: Matt York)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: In a photo finish, American Noah Lyles wins 100-meter final to claim Olympic gold
item.description: Lyles, the favorite to win, ran the fastest time in the fastest race at Stade de France stadium on Sunday night. He's the first American to win the race since Justin Gatlin in 2004.
item.content:encoded:
Lyles, the favorite to win, ran the fastest time in the fastest race at Stade de France stadium on Sunday night. He's the first American to win the race since Justin Gatlin in 2004.

(Image credit: Martin Meissner)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Renewed anti-government protests have left nearly 100 dead in Bangladesh
item.description: The protests began in July as students demanded an end to a quota system that reserved 30% of government jobs for families of veterans who fought in Bangladesh’s war of independence against Pakistan.
item.content:encoded:
The protests began in July as students demanded an end to a quota system that reserved 30% of government jobs for families of veterans who fought in Bangladesh’s war of independence against Pakistan.

(Image credit: Rajib Dhar)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
